Class Serializator

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class Serializator
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0 This static class collects common methods to serialize and de-serialize the framework.

        exportInferd - if true all the asserted axiom will be exported in the Ontology that will be saved
        Returns:
        OFSystemStates set of classes which represents the state of the OntologicalFramework

      • saveFrameworkState

        public static java.util.Set<OFSystemState> saveFrameworkState(java.lang.String ontoFilePath,
                                              boolean exportInf)
        It calls #saveFrameworkState(Set, Set, String) with the first two parameter equal to "null" and the third equal to ontoFilePath.
        Parameters:
        ontoFilePath - the folder directory in which you want to store the ontologies
        exportInferd - if true all the asserted axiom will be exported in the Ontology that will be saved
        Returns:
        OFSystemStates set of classes which represents the state of the OntologicalFramework

      • saveFrameworkState

        public static java.util.Set<OFSystemState> saveFrameworkState(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ontoToSerializeName,
                                              java.util.Set<java.lang.String> listToSerializeName,
                                              java.lang.String ontoFilePath,
                                              boolean exportInf)
        It goes across all the instances of OFBuildedListInvoker and, for each of them Instantiates a new OFSystemState. Those are collected in a Set and given as output. All the parameter of this function are passed to constructor: OFSystemState#OFSystemState(OFBuildedListInvoker, String, Set, Set)

        Parameters:
        ontoToSerializeName - list of OWLReferences instance names that we want to serialize. If it is equal to "null" than all the instances are serialized
        listToSerializeName - list of Names of the Individual linked to the builder by Object Property "buildsListName"
        ontoFilePath - the folder directory in which you want to store the ontologies
        exportInferd - if true all the asserted axiom will be exported in the Ontology that will be saved
        Returns:
        OFSystemStates set of classes which represents the state of the OntologicalFramework

      • serializeObjectToFile

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> serializeObjectToFile(java.util.Set<OFSystemState> toSerialize)
        It calls serializeObjectToFile(String, String, Set) where the first two parameters are "null" and the third is: toSerialize
        Parameters:
        toSerialize - set of classes which represents the state of the OntologicalFramework
        Returns:
        serializationPaths the set of paths in which objects has been serialized in a .".ser" file.

      • serializeObjectToFile

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> serializeObjectToFile(java.lang.String filePath,
                                                    java.lang.String fileName,
                                                    java.util.Set<OFSystemState> toSerialize)
        It iterate over all the value of toSerialize. For each of them it retrieves the serializable Map ( of type OFBuildedListInvoker) and writes it in a file.

        If filePath is "null" than the base files path will be: oFBuildedListInvoker_SerialMap.OFSystemState.getOntologyFilePath(). Otherwise filePath it must be an absolute map to a folder, in which serialize the framework Java classes

        If fileName is "null" than the name of a serialized Java Class will be OFBuildedListInvoker.getInstanceName(). Otherwise it will be fileName + ( count++).toString().

        In any case the complete path to a file will be: filePath + FileName + ".ser"}

        Parameters:
        filePath - folder path in which save the serialized Classes
        fileName - base name of the serialized Classes belong to the folder linked by filePath
        toSerialize - set of classes which represents the state of the OntologicalFramework
        Returns:
        serializationPaths the set of paths in which objects has been serialized in a .".ser" file.

      • deserializeOFBuildedListInvoker

        public static java.util.Set<ontologyFramework.OFRunning.OFInvokingManager.OFBuildedListInvoker> deserializeOFBuildedListInvoker(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> filePaths)
        It load the frame status from files and re-instantiate it. It load all the files and retreive the related Map than, for each of it makes this steps: 
                        1 -> get all OWLReferencesSerializable 
                        load all the ontologies calling new OWLReferences.
                        eliminate them from the Map
        2 -> for all the classes which are not Serializable.
                Get serializable objects and re-instantiate them.
                substitute those class between each other in the Map
        3 -> re-build the scheduler since is not Serializable
                substitute those class between each other in the Map
        4 -> re-build Debugging Map
                eliminate them from the Map
        5 -> re-build static property of Map and return it
        Parameters:
        filePaths - the set of paths in which objects has been serialized in a .".ser" file.
        Returns:
        loadedList the set of list builded and stored during serialization.
